description:
Man, this is just a great sandwich. I don't think the place as been touched since 1976 and it's immediately noticeable. But the man making the sandwiches does his job extremely well and service is friendly.

I've gotten the turkey/avocado/cheese toasted sub in different sizes at least 5-6 times now. It's just an excellent sandwich and even the small size will fill you up (the large size will require another meal to knock off).

This place has the ratings it has for a reason, don't miss it.
author: W N.

description:
I believe that sandwiches, at their highest level, are an art form - and I think that the owner or Marina Subs is a true sandwich artist. So much thought and care goes into each and every sandwich, this spot is the polar opposite of chain restaurant like subway. 

The only aspect I would change is the quality of meats and cheeses (also, why no cheddar cheese?). The ingredients don't hold up to the quality of the rest of the sandwich...let alone the sandwich maker. I would pay a few dollars more if that's what it took to enact this change. 

This spot is truly an SF institution and I can't recommend it more highly. I just wish some of the sand which ingredients where shored up.
author: Tom G.

description: Soooooo good. Classic subs with great ingredients and bread. AND zero skimping on meat.
author: Stebbin R.

description: Quite literally the best subs in SF.  Used to be sandwich spot down the street but they changed management. Theses guys have been consistent and the price point is much better. Recommend the Italian sub, no mayo.  Get only a couple of jalopenos for a little edge
author: David S.

description: This is one of our favorite places for a freshly made sandwich - we don't go anywhere else if we are close to the Marina. There is only one gentleman behind the counter who makes all the sandwiches so there is consistency in the quality of the sandwiches. He uses fresh ingredients (the avocados are my favorite) and takes great care to make delicious sandwiches. You'll need a good appetite because the sandwiches are generous- and remember to bring cash (this place takes only cash).
author: Nina A.

description: Incredible sandwiches in a local neighborhood spot. The ingredients are fresh and high quality and the portions of everything are so generous and a great value for the price! The Italiano was amazing, can't wait to come back and try the others!
author: Kim P.

description:
We don't get the good ratings and comments here...? 4 stars? Is this a joke? Do people have any clue about what decent food is supposed to be?
The turkey breast tasted like nothing close to natural food and it actually looked like engineered gelo for astronauts.
The place looks as bad as the food is.
We trusted the ratings and were deeply disappointed. Could not even finish our subs.
So avoid the place if you are actually looking for real sandwiches, there are many good options on Union and Chestnut that will spare you
a disgusting experience
author: Thibault L.

description:
Perhaps the best spot in the marina for subs to die for . They always exceed my expectations with my sub. As I am typing this, I'm enjoying a delicious cheese stake sub with roast beef and all the fixings. 
Thanks marina Submarine
author: Joseph Z.

description: Best submarine shop in the bay. Huge subs, fresh toppings, delicious sandwiches. Highly recommend stopping by this amazing sub shop.
author: Brendan G.

description: If you want a delicious sandwich made with the utmost precision and excellence, do yourself a favor grab a seat here. Muah! Buonissimo!
author: Zach B.

description: Marina Sub is my favorite sandwich in the neighborhood. Been going here for years. My favorite is the meatball sub but they're all good to be honest. Wish they had a bike share station nearby so we could go here more often.
author: Patrick T.

description: Sandwich delicious. I ordered the avocado and lettuce and he does not skimp on the avocado! The best part is watching this man work. He has such a beautiful style making these subs. It is like Benihana or watching a sushi chef. He makes it into an art.
author: Tiffany M.

description:
The most underrated sandwich spot in the city. 

The bread, meats,and the sauce are phenomenal. The owner/ cook 'Q" is also entertaining to watch as he dominates the knife from cutting avocados to assembling huge sandwiches. 

Must try!
author: Ankit S.

description: I've been going to this place since I was a little girl (let's just say it's been a few decades, ok?). The sandwiches are delicious, the bread is fresh every day and the service is outstanding. There's no glitz and glam but if you want a delicious, finger licking (special sauce) sandwich I'd come here. I suggest getting your sandwich toasted because it melts the provolone on your Italian sub and gives the bread that perfect crispy crunch. Man, it's making me hungry just typing this review.
author: Shell B.

description: This place is the closest thing you'll get in the Bay Area to a good east coast hoagie place. I'm a tough critic, and been coming here for years. The bread is good, the meats and veggies fresh, and it's run efficiently. All the ingredients are here for a great sandwich shop. I even like that's it's cash only, that's the way it should be for the good places.
author: Pat H.

description:
I lived a few blocks away from this place for almost a year before I found this hidden gem. The owner without fail is building the sandwiches daily and takes so much pride in his business. Every single time my sandwich is made to perfection. Perfectly toasted, balanced, delicious. 

I always get the turkey sandwich with everything on including avocado and hot banana peppers. This place hands down makes the best submarine sandwich I have ever had. 

Friendly staff, delicious food, quick and easy. I live in Austin now and still crave these subs. Looking for a replacement in my new home.
author: Emily K.

description:
My favorite place for a delicious, classic sub! Don't expect free range chicken breast and organic mixed greens; there are plenty of other places for that. At Marina Sub, you can expect a toasty sub loaf, plenty of creamy cheese and avocado, and zingy special sauce (Italian dressing). 

I grew up going here, so my favorites have ranged from turkey & cheese to the Italiano, and even the occasional meatball sub. I'm currently into the vegetarian/avocado...sounds weird, but it's basically like an Olive Garden salad in a sandwich. Can't get enough of it!

Reminder: cash only. There's a corner store with an ATM a block away on Fillmore and Union.
author: Natalie T.

description:
CASH ONLY

Probably the best deal you can find in the Marina! It's a simple place with nice people and good sandwiches. There's some indoor seating perfect for people watching.

I saw the reviews that the sandwiches here were huge and they weren't kidding. My boyfriend and I shared one medium turkey with avocado sandwich ($8) and it actually filled us both up for lunch. It was PACKED with turkey, cheese, tomatoes, lettuce, and large slices of avocado on warm crunchy bread. You definitely get your money's worth!
author: Linda X.

description: Unreal, get the italiano!! Cash only makes it 4 stars....otherwise would be 5 stars for sure based on the food.
author: Dustin B.

description: Absolutely delicious submarine sandwich.   Old school San Francisco.  Q is a master.  It's meditative to watch him slice up the avocado and assemble the sandwich.  The special sauce is essential.
author: Anne B.

description: This place is tight.  They use that thin shredded lettuce.  I don't know what you call it but I know it makes sandwiches better.  Get a medium, it's huge.  I don't think there is a sandwich in the city that makes me happier than an italiano from this place.
author: Kyle S.

description: Happened to come across this place while on my way to the mrs doubtfire house and I am glad I did. At the time, it was only one guy doing the sandwiches so it took a bit but it was ok. You can tell the man doing the sandwiches enjoys what he does. He had my 3 sandwiches on display and once he added the final touches he pretty much did the voila with his hands to show his work. I was amazed by his craft and the taste. Would come back for sure. Here is the magician.
author: Gabriel G.

description:
Not typically a sandwich person, but came here 2 weeks ago, got the large pastrami with everything, and have been craving it ever since.  Portions were HUGE- I ate half, was satisfied, and saved the other half for my mid-afternoon snack! I eat a lot, and this place does sandwiches right.

Good enough to warrant my first Yelp review! I have been daydreaming about this spot all day! GET SOME.
author: Chris C.

description:
I've been on a sandwich kick lately and so far, Marina Sub is on top of the list of multiple places in the city I've tried in the past month.Totally unassuming 'almost' hole-in-the-wall. Not much to say about ambiance, decor, or even staff, as every time I've been stopped in, it's just the owner manning the station. But man oh man, those sandwiches...

3 sizes available but "Small" is anything but. I struggle to finish even 1/2 of that. There's something about the combination of ingredients and the way they're prepared in the sandwich that just gels into heaven. The bread is amazing and bookends everything perfectly. I've tried the Submarine, Italiano, and even just basic turkey, and it's simply eyes-roll-to-the-back-of-your-head delicious.

At first I did catch a bit of a soup nazi vibe but now that's part of the appeal (last visit when I asked for the Italian, he corrected me: "You mean ITALIANO?" Nodded yes sir). I see a lot of regular locals in there and as I caught a glimpse of him slicing this beautiful avocado and cheese sandwich for a woman in front of me, she glanced back at me and cooed, "He's such an artist." Indeed, he is.
author: Jen E.

description: This is my favorite spot to get sandwiches in the city, he doesn't put too much random things on your sandwich. Just simple easy coast style subs. Melted cheese and fresh produce, he slices the meat and cheese every morning so everything is super fresh. Line is long sometimes and because it is only one guy who makes the sandwiches don't expect it to be a super fast experience. Worth the wait for sure, if your in a rush order ahead on the phone. Fresh, simple, subs made by someone who obviously cares about the quality, which is why he's the only one making the sandwiches. Also if you get  avocado, he literally puts an entire avocado on your sandwich.
author: Kay S.

description: Yes. Just do it. It's the best sandwich in San Francisco. You will wait, which gives you ample time to choose a variety of lays potato chips. It's worth it. Even my girl from the "east coast" says it's legit....I mean it's a damn good sandwich but didn't know it conquered the continental divide. Crush it Q!!!'
author: Matt H.

description:
Sometimes you just want a big ass sandwich. Not just any sandwich, you want a big ass good sandwich, aka not Subway. This place is awesome, for some reason, these sandwiches are just heavenly. I think what really takes it over the top  is the avocado. I've never gotten a sandwich here without avocado, and so long as avocados exist I will never have a sandwich here without one. In fact I love how they incorporate the avocado so much that if one day they didn't have avocados, I would walk my ass all the way to Safeway and bring one back. Basically, make sure you get avocado in your sandwich and you will understand why. 

Next, my sandwich of choice is the turkey avocado. I have never had anything but the turkey avocado, and it satisfies without compromise. Big as **** and just toasted to perfection. Has everything I need: special sauce, lettuce, tomatoes, onions, and pickles. No one else is going to do it better.

There really is no substitute for Marina Submarine. I've tried other places, but nope, this is the SPOT!
author: Alex L.

description:
First time, but my dad works construction in the city and recommended this place. 

What I had:
Ordered the hot pastrami no tomatoes or lettuce, added jalapeños and honestly one of the best Deli sandwiches I've ever had. 

Service:
The guy who go makes the sandwiches has been there for decades and takes his time to personally make every sandwich himself. While the wait is long the food ended up being really worth it. 

Price: 
Worth it- ~$10

Most sandwiches were under 10 bucks but the portions are gigantic. Medium is pretty big and was able to save half the sandwich for later. 

Verdict: 
TBH I don't even like deli Sandwiches all that much and i enjoyed this spot ALOT. If you love classic deli sandwiches or if ur not big on sandwiches and want to be wow'd by a classic sandwich I'd recommend this spot. 

Definitely coming back if I'm hungry af in the marina/divisidero area
author: David L.

description:
Super sweet family owned deli. I came in 5 mins before closing and boss welcomed me in. I only had $10 in cash, luckily that was just enough for a Medium long sando. I ordered a turkey & avo sandwich, prlly didn't have enough money for cheese which is fine cuz the sandwich was dang good. It was simple and hit the spot. He gave me extra jalapeños and avocado was fresh! The sandwich was huge! I heart toasted subs. 

Adouche came in to buy a Twix bar while boss was making my sandwich. Boss said he'll get to him in a minute. But of course Adouche cannot wait patiently and who goes into a deli just to buy a candy bar? I felt bad for boss but it didn't phase him. It just reminds me of the douches that feel entitled to act foolish in this area. Leave your douchiness at the door and don't forget o bring cash. 

I can't wait to come back, nice boss!
author: Margherita S.

description:
The hot pastrami is my new love. Only one guy makes the sandwiches and we will call him the sandwich whisperer because they are amazing! Stuff full, a special sauce, and good prices for the area it's hard to beat

Only downside cash only
author: Leslie M.

description: The sandwich was what i expected....Not that real quality meats or cheeses....But when you need to have that quick sub sandwich in the marina..THIS IS THE PLACE FOR A QUICK FIX
author: Kev V.

description:
Want a giant sub that can feed 2 people for around $10? This is the place to go.

Outside the place looks a bit rundown, inside you would probably think the same thing. Normally there will be a big line waiting for the master sub maker to work his magic. The wait can be a little long so if you plan ahead, call up and put through an order, the phone orders will sneak a few places up the line. Also bring cash.

I have tried the atomic, turkey and Italian combo. The atomic is awesome but massive and expensive. The turkey (with everything) is my usual and I really like it. I got the Italian combo once to try something new but I have gone back to turkey. If you get avocado make sure to watch as the slicing of the avocado is great.

I would probably give 5 stars if I could order straight away and sit down. The dude at the cash register stands there doing nothing most of the time (apart from taking cash slowly and answering the phone orders), not sure why he can't take an order in person (I tried, he couldn't do it).
author: Tristan L.

description:
Weekday, 1 PM - 3 people

I've had this type of sandwich before - it reminded me of East Coast delis where they really pile on the meat and extras, smush the bread on top, and wrap it up tightly until it's about to explode from the pressure.  Everyone gives rave reviews about this place, but I wasn't impressed.  With all the innovation going on right now in the SF sandwich scene, Marina Sub is an old-fashioned place with basic sandwiches.  This is probably enjoyable for some people, but I'd rather have more flavors incorporated into my food - take some risks and go for something that makes you stand out.  

Yes, the guy making the sandwiches is really good at cutting up avocados, and will give you as many pickles as you want.  The price point for what you get is not as good of a value proposition when you're comparing with Lou's or Sandwich Spot.

We ended up waiting about 20-25 minutes for our sandwich, and it wasn't THAT busy inside.  The reason?  There's 2 people 'working', but only 1 is actually working.  The guy making the sandwiches is a maestro, it's true.  Great at doing what he does, you can tell that his hands have crafted thousands of sandwiches and peeled thousands of avocados before.  The other guy, standing near the cash register, was just standing around doing nothing.  Literally, 25 minutes went by and these are the things he did while we were there:

1. Collected money
2. Gave back change
3. Stared at the wall
4. Put his hands in his pockets

It was infuriating to be waiting so long for sandwiches when only one person was actively contributing to the process.  The interior was pretty bare as well and there were very few distractions to pique my interest.  I'm not trying to wait a long time for a mediocre sandwich.
author: Ben K.

description: Q is an ASSASSIN when it comes to avocados. When the world avocado cutting championships happen, I'm betting the house on Q. Now, as for the food...DELICIOUS deli sandwich really couldn't ask  for more!
author: Nickon R.

description:
My favorite subs in sf. 

The owner, Q, is great. 

My go to is the italiano. The sauce they use on it is amazing. Huge sandwich. Full of meat, cheese, veggies, and toasted, for 9 bucks for a medium (which is actually pretty large). I add a few jalapeños for some kick.
author: Sam B.

description:
Horrible quality. High sodium, mass produced meats and cheeses. They don't hide this. I should've walked. The reality is; a LOT OF PEOPLE don't care. If you're one of those, this place is 5 stars. For the rest, it's rot gut quality. Sorry to be blunt. But again they don't hide it. It's in the deli case. 

It's my fault for going against my better judgement, I will not, ever, be back. 

The fact they are hanging solid in the marina instead, tells you quantity is revered when it comes to even wealthy hoods. Quality.. Take a back seat, B.
author: Nik D.

description: Got the submarine on a Friday afternoon going up to Tahoe. Inexpensive and great food. Nice owner, just need to have some cash on you
author: Colin O.

description: Love this sandwich spot, he understands the love for avocado on a sandwichwish he had a secret spicy sauce
author: Nicki N.

description: I came in my pants after a single bite. My shoes, soggy with jizz, left a trail to where I sat in a dizzying state of ecstasy, covered in flaky bread crumbs.
author: Naters H.

description: I have been coming here for years and the quality, taste and ambiance still the same! Great service, great sandwiches, great price!! Italiano and Turkey and avocado can't be beat. Don't let the line scare you. It moves fast.
author: E H.

description: Ok I get it. The place doesn't look good. But the Chinese man who owns and lives it is adorable. And he really did make the best sub in the area. Best sandwich in San Francisco for sure!! If you have time, eat there cause it gets soggy after an hour. Order the Italiano and get some chips.
author: Jimmy S.

description: I get it, the guy knows how to cut an avocado.  Put that aside and you realize it's slow, cash only, the menu is too limited, and the sandwiches are pretty bland.  The shop is run down and the owner treats his cashier like garbage.  I've been here a half dozen times because I live nearby and every time I leave I have a worse impression.
author: John S.

description: Q makes this place special. His commitment to subs is commendable and he works his tail off every single day to personally make subs as an art. His scoops of avocado are perfect and I love the turkey. No better spot to get a sandwich in the marina and to support local businesses.
author: Chris P.

description: Love the humongous subs at Marina Subs! Cash only. Call in your order in and pick up will save you time. The subs are made one at a time by the owner.
author: Kim M.

description:
Good prices for the huge portions. "Small" feeds two people. No frills place and owner...all business!

Turkey avocado is my go to. Bread's amazing (think Jimmy John's but better)
author: Darius D.

description: What more could you ask for? Same guy (one guy) has been making sandwiches there since before any of us on this thread were even born. If nothing else just go and watch him chop up avocados! If you like avo he finely slices it up and puts a whole one on ur sandwich, with sushi chef precision. I eat my own weight in food daily and I can barely put down a large! Glorious prices too
author: James A.

description:
I usually don't give 5 stars, but this place deserves it!
I've been devouring  these sandwiches since the 80's....the original was on California and Masonic st. What's mind blowing is that the sandwiches taste exactly how they did back when I was growing up!!! I talked to the owner and he said and I quote "I have not changed a single thing as far as ingredients and preparations goes" end of quote!
However, he does add avocado, if you like and I like:) 

Note: you will never find a place that puts this much avocado on your sandwich period!!!
author: Al T.

description:
It's all in the secret sauce...

The sandwiches are way bigger than they need to be and always delicious.  The service can be pretty slow, and the sandwich maestro apparently refuses to hire an apprentice.   Great for a leisurely Saturday lunch, but not a Monday if you're looking for something quick.
author: Malachi Z.

description: My husband and I used to live in this neighborhood 20yrs ago when we were singles. This place was our favorite lunch spot. We've moved around the world since then for our jobs, but always come back here whenever we are in SF. So happy to see him still making the best sub in town and people still lining up for it. God bless!
author: Sam K.

description: Went here to get sandwiches 2 weekends in a row. Quick service and especially like how sub maker kept washing his hands a lot! Highly recommend this place for weekend lunch :)
author: Soran R.

description: i love their sandwiches! consistently delicious and fresh. never been unsatisfied. the smallest one is so filling, he makes a MEAN SANDWICH
author: Mallory V.

description: I work in sf every day and I eat out everyday when I get to work in this area I surely come here best sandwiches ever. Unbelievable I'm a big guy and the small etomic sandwich is plenty for 2 meals lol
author: Mario R.

description:
Made to order sandwiches that are huge!  I live on the same block as Marina Subs and am here about once a month because of how conveniently close it is.  I usually end up getting a small and saving 1/2 for later.  High-quality ingredients, delicious "secret sauce", and fresh avocado that is impressively sliced to order by the owner.  
My only gripes: there is always an extremely long wait and they accept cash only.  I recommend calling ahead and then adding an additional 5-10 mins onto the 20 mins they usually quote.  Not sure why they don't just hire a second person to help with making the sandwiches...?
The pricing is also a little steep, Luccas is 4 blocks away with more variety in meats /cheeses and lower pricing (comparable wait time for walk-ins).  That being said, the quick walk across the street for me is worth paying a little extra.
author: Leah R.

description:
I am not a sandwich or sub girl but damn... He makes the best subs ever. 

If you go during lunch time I would recommend calling in to order then picking it up. We went without calling and had to wait a good 30 mins just to get our sandwiches since there were so many phone orders coming in and a few people in front of us. But it is so worth the wait if you have the time! 

He is very generous with his ingredients. Lots of meat, cheese, and if you opt for avocado he adds in an entire avocado! There are 2 sizes, small and large. I can eat a 6" subway and be full. I got full after about half of a small due to the bountiful of ingredients in each bite! Although, if I really wanted to, I could have finished a small and been disgustingly full. My fiance is a hefty eater and always orders a large so that he can save the other half for another meal. 

Do try this spot if you're in the area or need to satisfy a sub craving, you won't be disappointed!
author: Vivian L.

description: Cash only is a little frustrating. Great sandwiches but it takes such a long time! The owner / main guy is nice but won't let his co worker assist besides handling the money which could help speed it up. Slow speed and cash only combine to remove a star.
author: Robert S.

description: Decent neighborhood sandwiches, great value for the price. I go the Italian and wasn't overly impressed and the bread gets pretty soggy quickly from the secret sauce so don't get this hoping to have leftovers.  Overall since its close to me I'll be back when I want a good sandwich, but definitely didn't LOVE it and if I find something I love, they may not see me again!
author: Gieselle A.

description:
Great sandwiches, that sauce really makes a difference!  It gets pretty crowded at lunch time, call in your order so you don't have to wait.  Sandwich maker and staff member may not be the warmest people, but I don't really go there for the sunny demeanor.

They raised their prices!  I've updated the menu to the best of my ability; I'm pretty sure the prices are accurate in the picture, but don't hold me accountable if you find something is off.
author: Rita H.

description: This place is an icon for anyone who grew up and/or went to school in the north side of the city. I don't live in the bay area anymore and only come about once a year on average now, and yet Q still knows my order. It can get very crowded at peak hours (I've seen people call in phone orders while waiting in line), but I go there to have a sandwich made by Q; I am 100% am okay with other people not making the sandwiches. Authentic San Francisco. One place I always go when I return to my home city, and I am sure that's the case for many others.
author: Michael K.

description: Best pastrami sandwich I've ever had. He asked if I wanted jalapeños and I said yes and he gave me like two handful worth of jalapeños.  Which I loved.  Ton of thick cut meat,  lot of sprouts,  definitely got my money worth.  Not sure if it was just me but after he wrapped up my sandwich because it was for to go.  He did this thing like a little prayer to it.  I don't come around here often but this place will always be on my mind if I'm craving for a sub.
author: Stanley L.

description:
Not a gourmet or nice sandwich shop. Cheap quality meats and produce. 

There was only one guy making sandwiches and it took forever. Saw a few people walk in, wait in line then leave.

Another downside was that it was cash only
author: Ulrich C.

description: Not only does this place make the best sandwiches in the city but they are the most awesome people around. With a great attitude honest and dependable trustworthy consistent amazing service and sandwiches. Thank you!
author: justin r.

description: This is quite a modest shop on the inside when you consider the outside advertising. The fellow making the subs is not very jolly but the bloke taking the money is up for a chat. We had a large Italiano cut into two. It was still too big. For $10.55 you could cut it into thirds to feed three.
author: Sue L.

description:
Been coming here 20 years plus. Best sandwiches in SF. If you're not from the city and want to complain about how long Q takes, then honestly please never come here, and frankly, just leave. The sandwiches are delicious and it really isn't debatable, this is a factual statement. 

Extra sauce. Add avocado and jalapeños. Call your order in ahead and bring cash. The kid working the register is always what's his name's little brother. Don't be a dick, tip him a buck or two, and quit whining about the wait. Q has never let anyone else make the sandwiches. Not even his kids. The place is an institution. Subs is what SF is really about. The city grew up around places like Marina Sub.
author: Whitney B.

description: Q is the best. My go tos are 1) turkey avo or 2) meatball sub with provolone and jalapeños
author: Stacie C.

description: Great sandwiches.  Try the avocado and sprouts but they are all good.  Right out of the 1970's and a real city insitution.
author: Bill S.

description: They have such a good tasty sandwiches ! I am working around there neighbors and get them often! But it's really big even order size small!
author: Yuki K.

description: Marina Sub is a hidden gem! This place has been around for the longest time and never fails to disappoint (even on busy days because it's worth the wait). The Asian sandwich maker stacks each and every sandwich making it "the best bang for your buck". Make sure to bring CASH ONLY.
author: Julian T.

description: Q has been in the business of making GREAT sandwiches for 29 years!!! Period.
author: Vivian E.

description:
I called today to place an order for one small sandwich to pick up on my lunch. I had a feeling it would be busy so I made sure to call ahead of time since I was on my lunch break (I work down the street). 

I called and placed my order and they told me it would be 20 minutes. 20 minutes for one sandwich?? I figured it was probably really busy so I tried to be understanding.

20 minutes later I walk to the shop and tell them I placed my order over the phone and paid. When I got there there was a crowd of people waiting to order their sandwich. Those people were walk-ins so they were waiting for their sandwich to be made.

To my surprise when I came in to tell I placed the order I see that my sandwich has not even been made yet. There's only one person making all the sandwiches. I get it, it's busy so I give him the benefit of the doubt and wait a little longer for my sandwich to be made.

20 more minutes pass and my sandwich has not even been made yet and I start getting really angry because the owner is taking everyone's orders and even making orders of walk ins that came in AFTER me and I'm still waiting for my sandwich. I remind the cashier that I placed an order and waited another 10 minutes.

At this point I'm extremely upset because I only get an hour lunch and now I've wasted 50 minutes waiting for a sandwich that I called to order ahead of time to avoid this exact thing. Obviously they forget about my order. Now I spent my entire lunch waiting for a sandwich and won't even be able to eat it. 

I won't ever be returning here. Thanks for wasting my time and money.
author: Annie N.

description:
Italiano con todo!

Everyone orders the turkey cheese avocado which is great, however, I've seen him making some other stuff that looks amazing like the Italian Beef and Atomic sub...

I, personally, get the Italiano with everything and it's one of my go-to spots in the neighborhood.
author: max m.

description:
this place is da shit! I've been coming here since i was a kid and its still the same old asian dude making these bomb ass subs. its a one man band with him so be patient bc your tastebud will be thanking you later. watch the way he cuts the avocados is precision and magic. someone needs to record that so i can watch that on loop like 100 times.

i always get a small turkey with avo toasted with extra Italian magic sauce, no cheese. it tasted amazing back then and its still the exact same today!




@devour_sf 
#devourthat
author: Lia B.

description:
The level of expertise required to produce submarines of such perfection surely comes with decades of experience and dedication to the craft.

The owner/deli master has clearly spent a lifetime perfecting the art of the submarine sandwich.  Not only is his technique flawless (you watch him make the sandwiches behind the counter) his rapport with customers is effortless and relaxed.

The ingredients they use are always fresh and the bread is delicious.  Also, they'll happily split a sub for you and a friend if you ask (they're big).

Don't be intimidated by the sandwich maker's samurai sub skills.  He is simply the best at what he does anywhere in the world.
author: Foodie B.

description: I always love grabbing a sub from this place. Top notch deli with some great options. Very hearty meals that keep you full for hours. Pastrami is my favorite. Great pricing as well.
author: Cameron N.

description:
Classic subs without the corporate bs. These subs are straight up delicious. Cash only, and like anywhere in the Marina, good luck finding parking.

PRO TIP: call in your order, they make those before walk-ins.
author: Aly H.

description:
We've been coming here since it moved here. We feed our entire sailboat crew on Marina Subs. There has NEVER been a complaint and because we have a lot of guests who've never had a Marina Sub, they end up as customers. I see a lot of my crew there now!

This is a small family business. If you want fast mass produced food - go someplace else. This is old school, do it right, best possible stuff inside, sort of sandwich place. The iPhone order, in and out in 3 minutes group should wander back to SoMa. 

Great food and great people.
author: Beau V.

description:
This is a no frills sub shop. You get a great big sandwich for a very fair price. The operation is just a deli board, a register, and that's about it. They pile the sandwiches high with comically large slices of pickle and avocado. One guy said "extra, extra pickles" and he received two whole 4" long dill pickles, sliced thin, and smushed between the bread. You definitely get your money's worth.

My boyfriend and I shared a medium Italian sub and it was just the right amount to share. A large would have been too much. (The sandwiches really are huge.) Overall, I was pleased with it. I did try the Special Sauce - it made for a really drippy sandwich.

If it seems like I am taking my sandwiches too seriously, I have to admit that I am desperately looking for equivalent to a Boston style Italian sub that I could get at any corner deli in any town back home. So while the Marina Sub shop filled a certain gritty hole in my sandwich-loving heart, it didn't hit the spot. I'd come back for another sandwich but not on purpose!
author: Halley S.

description:
I called my boyfriends roommates pussies for splitting a large.

I retract that statement completely.

These sandwiches are GIGANTIC and packed with goodness. I didn't think it was possible to OD on avocado, but I kind of did. Not complaining. They claim a large is 10'', but it is the biggest 10'' sandwich I've ever seen.

Pros:
- Toppings are fresh and they have sprouts! They give huge portions of avocado! And they have peppers. Mmm....
- Call an order in, and your sandwich will be waiting for you 15 minutes later.

Cons:
- None? I've been fortunate to never have experienced a long wait here. I heard it grows up to 1 hour long because theres only one sandwich dude.
author: Jess C.

description:
I have been coming here for nearly 18 years.

Sandwiches are fantastic, but the line takes forever.
author: Lloyed C.

description:
Marina Submarine definitely has quirky old school charm, with beer signs and a Korean sandwich maker. The secret sauce is a tangy Italian dressing. Sandwiches come in three sizes - 5 inch, 7 inch & 10 inch. Sandwiches include chicken salad, atomic, Italian cold cut, tuna salad, meatballs. 

* Medium pastrami sandwich ($6.25): The toasted narrow roll was decent but burnt on top. The pastrami was quite flavorful. The sandwich had the usual fixings - shredded lettuce, tomato, mustard, onions, mayo, jalapeno and special sauce. It was a hefty sandwich and tasty but with construction and toasting issues. It was too wet so it did get soggy fast.

Cash only.
author: Lolia S.

description: Cannot beat the quality of the sub! Medium sandwiches that is really for 2 people or ONE VERY HUNGRY person. Generous with their onions, tomatoes and order the avocado with it, you should get ONE whole cut to perfection! This is my place to go for a sandwiches. Btw, you can call ahead. Last of the family submarine sandwiches shop! Order the Italiano.
author: LL Y.

description: One of the most deliciously frustrating sins you will ever have. The owner makes each sub meticulously himself, and the product is one of the best in the city, but be prepared to wait.
author: Aaron C.

description: Perfect sub. Perfectly toasted bread, love the special sauce (dressing), and the way the owner scoops and cuts the avocado is a show in itself. Consistently good because the owner makes every sandwich to perfection - employees only work drinks and register. I always get turkey.
author: Ruth C.

description: These are wonderful subs. My neighbor friend loves the corned beef with extra mayo and I like the turkey and avocado. Cute owner as well
author: Tina S.

description:
OLD SKOOL GOODNESS!

Good sandwiches at incredibly cheap prices compared with other options nearby.  You want avocado on that sandwich- you will get a ton of avocado!  Generous portions and nice team working there.

The place is in desperate need of an update.  Looks like maintenance isn't a priority at all- holes in the wall, flies circling and a menu board that must be at least 30 years old.  

That said- some damn fine sandwiches!
author: Jory S.

description: Awesome subs!!! I live in LI, NY and this shop can go toe to toe with the best deli's in NY. Great spot!! Everything is good and worth the wait. Highly Recommend!!
author: Brian M.

description:
I was doing some counseling work in the Marina District. The appointment took longer than expected, thus my somewhat empty stomach has landed me at this corner deli on Union Street. 

This deli is owned and operated by a Korean man, who is also the sandwich-maker. The cashier is a young guy who is probably a Harry Potter aficionado or a devotee to comic books. They both are nice and assisted my needs. 

As a high-volume eater, I ordered one of the deli's featured sandwich: the "Atomic Submarine" Sandwich. The $9.95 "unhealthy" sandwich has slices of Corned Beef, Turkey, Ham, Melted Provolone, the usual condiment in a sandwich and a special sauce that the owner won't reveal in a toasted 7-inch roll. The heated sandwich is indeed big and can be an health-weapon for nuclear clog in your artery. 

I also bought a bottle of Orangina to complete my meal. This deli also serves Gelatos. 

As I was enjoying my hefty sandwich, many of the people were enjoying the Meatball sandwich. I might try that sandwich when I come back very soon.

Cash only!
author: Matt G.

description: Sandwiches  are amazing - but beware - people come in with orders for 5 people and they put all call in orders ahead of patrons in the store - coupled with only one person making sandwiches it's never worth coming here when it's busy - look for a stack of papers in the prep area - that means your order won't get started for 20 minutes even though you are second in line -
author: Tamas G.

description:
Wayyy understaffed

Noon on a Saturday and it took 30 minutes
author: Thomas D.

description:
I was happy with our sandwiches here. It's true that the sandwiches seem to get an entire avocado, which is pretty astonishing for $1. The turkey meat is a little subpar but not bad - kind of like the bread. The meatball sandwich is pretty solid. literally and figuratively - better than many I've had in the city, but not coming close to Tony's or Morty's. The pastrami is in a similar realm - not the tops, but pretty decent. The toppings/condiments were similarly "A-OK" - I was glad they offered jalapenos, but there wasn't anything too fancy going on over all.
I had good luck calling in an order around 1:45 on a Sunday - I still had to wait 5-10 minutes once I showed up, but I found the two employees to be pretty friendly.
author: Lisa K.

description:
You will not leave this place hungry.  The sandwiches are very good.  I normally order the Italiano and pickles.

Tip:  Call in your order if you are in a hurry.  However, be careful as the Italian dressing will eat through the bag.
author: Justin L.

description:
I used to live down the street from Marina Sub and was a regular patron.  I have to say that Marina Sub is hands down my favorite sub, which is curious, because if I were analyze the sandwich objectively, without question it has its shortcomings.   

The ingredients, such as the bread, meats, cheese, mustard, etc. are nothing special.  In fact, some would say they're pedestrian.  Stroll down to Ultra Lucca and they've got some great bread and meats, but something has kept bringing me back to Marina Sub for years.

Something magical happens when the owner (who makes ALL the sandwiches) throws everything together.   It tastes like a thing of beauty!  After the once lackluster bread is toasted and stacked high with mediocre meats, veggies, bland American mustard & mayo, with a little italian sauce splashed on and more Avocado than you thought you could consume in a week, the sub transformation is complete, and it is AMAZING!  I can't tell you exactly why, because it defies logic.  How could assembling mediocre ingredients result in something so delicious, but it does?!  Trust me on that!

Tip:  Hands down, my favorite sandwich is Turkey & Avocado.  The owner slices full avocados just right...finely sliced and very generous, and the result is the best T&A you'll ever get!  Make sure to add peppers as well! 

Tip 2:  Avoid to-go orders if you can help it or be very careful with the sandwich during transport.  They add italian dressing, and if you're not careful, you'll end up with a soggy sandwich, which totally defeats the purpose.
author: Jeremy K.

description:
Many years ago when I was 18, I obtained a job in this area and managed to discover Marina Submarine.  I ended up coming here nearly every lunch shift while I was working because it was way more filling and cheaper than the other lunch options in the Marina.  

What I love most about these sandwiches is that Q, the amazing owner of many years now, uses an entire avocado for your sandwich.  I have never been to another place that uses more than half of an avocado (and they're usually small too).  He's extremely kind and loves what he does which is another reason I always went back.

It's cash only, but I have no qualms with that as this is a local business trying to sustain itself.  Be sure to always phone in your order or you'll get a headache and extremely frustrated.

Unfortunately I live on the other side of the city and have a different job now but I always try to stop by whenever I happen to be in the Marina by chance.  :)
author: Stephy S.

description: I like their subs, but they only accept cash which is a super bummer because if I don't have cash on me, I can't eat there (and the bank is too far away to get cash and walk back.)  For a sandwich shop, I recommend it and will return.
author: Shaun W.

description:
3.5 stars.

A failed attempt to go to That Takes the Cake (they need to update their website and Yelp page with their new business hours, hmph) led me to getting a sub here.  I've seen Marina Submarine many times but never really bothered to go in.  Today I was grumpy and hungry and I could smell the bread being baked or toasted as I walked by.  I ordered a sammie to go.

I ordered hot pastrami with no mayo or mustard..yeah..I like my sandwiches dry.  I don't need the extra calories from the mayo!  The lettuce and tomatoes in the sandwich tasted really fresh.  Tomatoes and onions were both sliced nice and thin which I loved!  The bread was soft and a little flaky on the outside.  

Now the pastrami...I don't know if its been a long time since I've had pastrami or if its always been really salty but I thought I was licking a salt block!  The  pastrami was a little fatty, which I didn't mind...but it was oh so salty!  All the salt made my throat felt funny as the day went on.

I would be back again to try other sandwiches, but I think I'll pass on the pastrami.
author: Steph D.

description:
I love this place. The guy who owns the joint has an amazing memory. I'm here maybe one a year and he remembers my order. What?!

Plus the portions are big, which is good because, you know, I'm a major fatty. Case in point: I just ate here even though I already had lunch because I was in the neighborhood and had time to kill.

So worth it. Yum.
author: Patrick L.

description:
Been wanting to review this local spot for sometime...Best. Subs.Ever. The same guy makes every sub, and has for years. There is a consistency here you will never find anywhere else. I get the turkey avocado sub which is toasted and has a complete avocado on it. Incredible sandwich.  Anytime I'm looking for a quick meal, this is the go to. Secret sauce is amazing.  Bread, amazing (I'm guessing Acme?)
Highly recommended!!!!!!
author: Dan S.

description: Straightforward sub sandwiches in a no-frills environment. I had the Italiano but was jealous of the turkey avocado I saw afterward. Literally so much avocado for the price - super deal.
author: DJ W.

description: I love this place! Although it's always busy, you know you're going to get a great sandwich every time and it's ALWAYS worth the wait. Give the sandwich guy some credit, he's the only person making sandwiches!!!!!
author: Natalie M.

description: Before you come to Marina Subs, please bring cash and make sure you're starving.  These sandwiches are PACKED with goodness. I got the large Italian combo which is filled with beef and sausages. I then proceeded to add lettuce, tomatoes, cheese, and jalapenos. I'm a big eater and I could only eat half of it. The sub itself was pretty darn good. Definitely a bang for your buck!
author: Kevin L.

description:
If it's your first time here, do yourself a favor and get the Italiano with avocado. Marvel at how much meat goes on there and then think about Subway... and those 3 little slabs they give you. Marina Sub is the real deal. Also, the "small," "medium," and "large" sizes are pretty much a joke. I'm about 179 on a good day, 185 on a bad day, and a small is just fine for me. These are some serious sandwiches. 

The sandwich maker here is really more of an artist than anything else. Waiting in line for a sandwich has been likened to waiting for the soup nazi. You might be in the front of the line, but he might have four phone orders that he feels like filling first. So in that case, you wait. Deal with it. The sandwiches are awesome.
author: Kevin H.

description: Go with a small (still massive) turkey avocado and add jalapeños.  Call ahead, and call back to check because sometimes it takes a bit, but definitely worth it and a great meal for 10 bucks.  Q is the man!
author: Jake T.

description:
BEST SUBS IN SAN FRAN!
But seriously these are super tasty sandwiches. The fillings are quite simple: choice of meat, cheese, veggies (avocado, tomato, sprouts, lettuce, onion) and spread.  The bread is toasted, the cheese is melted and everything is so stuffed into the sub that some of the fillings tend to fall out while you're devouring it; but hey isn't that half the fun of eating a sandwich anyways? 
The shop is kinda small, with only a few tables around to eat on location. Also the line for a sandwich can get long because the guy who owns Marina Submarine is the ONLY person who makes the sandwiches. This is why I believe they are so consistently tasty.
author: Molly R.

description:
I give this place 3 stars for the food (and 1 star for the proprietor and his skills). I know I know...how DARE I?!?!?

But I work near some awesome places for sammiches (like Luccas) so I am baised but I have to admit I was curious about Marina Sub as I had heard good things from friends. So one day while working from home, I decided to meander down the hill to try it out. There was no line (woah right?) and the sub-nazi was primed with his knife. He truly is gruff but took my order without hesitation and even cracked a steely smile at the end when I batted my eyes at him and said thank you.

I had my sammich in 5 minutes and the awkward kid behind the counter rang me up.

I went home and have to admit I liked what I saw. Lots of meet, good bread. Not enough veggies but I am a fan of lettuce and tomatoes and onions etc. But a solid sammich nonetheless and will warrant a repeat trip with the bf as he is a sammich  snob and will want to try the Italiano like I did.
author: Kathy K.

description: Eh...it's no Ike's Place or Little Lucca's but it's pretty decent.  A little on the expensive side, too, if you ask me...
author: Rose A.

description:
I hate waiting in lines. However, today was different.

I kept watching the sandwich guy slice up avocado. It was the combination of his trusty knife, his speed and accuracy of slicing it into thin pieces of avocado that made me stare in awesome wonder.

Watching him was like watching a master at his craft and I felt like a captivated audience, I wasn't antsy at all to order, I was just in awe of his knife skills.

Oh the food? Sorry, I was drooling over dude's knife skills.

I ordered a salami and cheese sandwich with all the fixins, except onions and avocado. I kept mine classic with a jalepeno twist. Mmm, sweat formed just biting into my sandwich.

It was damn good.
author: Sharon B.

description:
Q has done an awesome job for years. The subs are simple and always good. 

Get the dressing on the side if you get a takeout order.
author: David M.

description:
Seriously people? Seriously? There is no reason that the line should be so long and the service should be so awful. There are people in SF who can get away with running there own show and you wait because they are nice and apologetic and have a personality. After waiting for AN HOUR today we FINALLY got to the front of the line...only to sit there for another 20 minutes while the guy made all the to-go sandwich orders...?? Uh what? Dude dont have a store front if you are going to focus on the phone orders. I should have just ordered from my cell in line and it would have been faster. 

Seriously save your time and your money....there are plenty of places in SF that will toast your bread and throw on some creamy Italian dressing on your sandwich.
author: Lovin S.

description: Probably the best sandwiches you can get within a few miles.  The owner is a little odd in that the closing time is variable, so don't plan on getting a late lunch here.
author: Morgan S.

description:
Marina Submarine is one of my favorite sandwich spots in San Francisco. I don't get to make it out there often, but when I do, it's a big deal.

Sandwiches are personally made by the owner, one-by-one, so you're guaranteed to get an end-product that has been fully attended to. If you see a line, don't be discouraged, he works incredibly fast. You should see the guy prepare an avocado - his movements are so fluid and effortless, it's clear he's been doing this for years. Aside from that, the owner is a stand-up guy. He's really friendly, and tries his best to accommodate you and your requests. He's always been pleasant.

I always order the Roast Beef on Dutch Crunch, and I've never been disappointed. Sandwiches are flavorful and dressed with his house sauce - perfection. 

Be sure to bring cash. If not, then it's a pretty far trek to the next Bank of America. If that's the case for you, rest assured that if you need to make that extra trip, it is very much worth it.
author: Nicole I.

description: Amazing sandwiches!  Hardest working sandwich artist I have ever witnessed.  The precision of a sushi chef.  I had the Pastrami and loved it.  Uses two whole avocados in the small avocado sandwich.  Very nice people. Great value!
author: Mark A.

description:
I will never go there again! 
I don't care how good the food is... If I order for pick up, you tell me it'll be ready in 10-15 minutes... And I stand there for an extra 10 with no sorry for waiting or no thank you and you THROW my sandwich on the counter!!!!! Yeah... Thanks, but no thanks. I will be spending my money elsewhere!!!!!!!!!!! 

SO RUDE!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
author: Mary J.

description:
Sub Center (Ulloa) of the Marina. Same menu, same setup.

I thought the guy was Japanese due to his knife skills and perfectionist technique (Korean per the reviews). The lettuce and onions are sliced super thin, lending to a crisp fresh texture in your sandwich. Bread toasting might be slightly better at the Ulloa location, but the assembly is way better here. 

The bread isn't sliced all the way through (butterflied), so the sandwich doesn't fall apart. Same secret sauce, and pickled jalapenos thrown in after I agreed.

Bigger sandwiches to boot.
author: Derrick V.

description:
I feel bad writing this review because the owner seems really nice, but I really didn't like my sub - not even a little bit. 

I eat a lot of sandwiches - whenever I'm in a new place I try and find a sub shop that's how much like sandwiches. I always order the same thing - turkey, light on the mayo, swiss cheese. No secret sauce, nothing else. 

Sadly, my sandwich just wasn't good. The bread was super tasty, but the meat was slimy and I'm pretty sure that I either didn't get swiss cheese or the cheese had gone bad. It actually tasted nasty. 

There's just one guy making all of the sandwiches, so give him a break! He's busting his ass to make you food. I think it adds to the authenticity of the place. 

I understand that my food preferences may be different than yours, so the only other con this place has (I didn't hold it against Marina Sub in my review) is the surroundings. Normally, I don't mind the Marina douches as I used to live there, but the ones outside at the moment that I was there particularly pissed me off. Marina Sub is an open door place, which means that if you are loud, obnoxious, and smoking, it affects everyone inside. After 5 minutes of listening to 6 dumbasses recount all of the slutty things they did the night before I was already irritated when they all started smoking. I actually went outside and asked them to move. One of them rolled her eyes at me like it was the most outlandish request ever. I don't hold this against Marina Sub, but if your tolerance for doucheyness is less than mine, go somewhere else.
author: Jennifer L.

description: Sometimes you just crave a simple, well crafted, no frills sandwich, right? Good bread, quality meats with a heavy hand, classic veggies, this is my kind of place. Italian subs, pastrami, meatball subs are some of my favs. The turkey advocado is making its way onto my rotation, too. These sandwiches are huge and not for the faint of heart
author: Ross I.

description:
The line here is ridiculous! Why? Because there's only one person making sandwiches. I'm no efficiency expert, but I know that a popular place needs more than that!  It excruciatingly frustrating to watch.  I don't care how good they are. At least get one more person to wrap a sandwich or replace the ingredients!  

Just had the sandwich, it's good.  I feel bad for the guy running the place.  He seems really nice.  But honestly, there's no way I can wait for an hour to get a sandwich when the line is only 5 people deep.
author: Joe S.

description:
Eerily similar to Submarine Center on Ulloa out in West Portal. Who came first? Are they the same? Doesn't matter to me because they both use their special sauce that they add to every sandwich. 

We ordered a large turkey avocado sandwich. This thing is not only large, it can feed two large people. And they're not skimpy with the avocado. Some places, you're luck to get a few slices, but here they cut out half of avocado before spreading it out and adding more to make sure every bite is covered. Sadly, this sandwich we ordered to go was missing the one thing that made coming here worth it - the special sauce. Without, it was just an ordinary turkey avocado sandwich. Wah wah wah...

It was orderly chaotic inside, with the wait times for sandwiches ranging from 15-30 minutes. With only the same poor old guy making sandwiches and his relative as the cashier, he couldn't quite keep up with the pace of the orders. Hopefully they can get another body in there to help out. 

It's a hefty sandwich and decent if you're out in the Marina, but if I were given a choice, I'd easily and every time choose Submarine Center. 

____

Jan '12 Health score - 86
Good luck finding parking on the weekends!
author: Dennis L.

description: Not the friendliest of services, but the sandwich was very yummy. Prices were fairly reasonable. There are three different sizes and the small is around $6.45 and it goes up from there for the next size. There are a few tables to eat at inside. It's all self-service.
author: Sharon G.

description:
Small avocado and cheese with mustard, lettuce, tomato and special sauce. Same sandwich every time, can't go wrong. The owner/sandwich-maker knows what he is doing with avocados. I have heard him referenced as the "avocado nazi", for you Seinfeld fanatics, he is right up there with the Soup Nazi, I get a little nervous when talking to him. No lie, he puts TWO full avocados, on my small sandwich, it should not be allowed, but I keep telling myself that avocados are the good kind of fat so it's ok :)

I can't vouch for much more on the menu, since I only get the one type of sandwich. But do be aware that at lunch time, the line tends to be out the door, oh and it's CASH ONLY, which in today's world still seems crazy to me, but the guy has a good business going so I guess why change it.
author: Lauren S.

description: I think I made a mistake by ordering the tuna sub. The tuna salad is made with olives, which I don't like, so that pretty much ruined the sandwich for me. The pickles, however, are enormous, juicy, and delicious.
author: Jennifer D.

description: Easily the best sandwich in the neighborhood if not the city. I eat here a lot..
author: Philip D.

description:
Great sub, lots of fresh veggies. I always call ahead, never wait in the line! 

As everyone else is saying, he includes a WHOLE avocado, if not two. It's great and always fresh, easy if you work around there like I do. 

Service is so, so, be nice to the kid, as for the old man...just keep your order short and to the point!
author: Molly M.

description: Pining for an authentic Philly style Italian sandwich over xmas, I found this place on Yelp and was not disappointed. Great grinders/sandwiches at a very reasonable price. Next time I will take the advice and call ahead.   We had the Submarine and the Avocado sandwiches and they were both great!
author: David S.

description:
If ever I am a death row inmate, Marina Sub will be my choice for last meal. Hopefully the warden will also honor my request that Kyu ("Q"), the owner and sandwich maker, be allowed to come to the prison to make the sandwich. There are many things I love about Marina Sub. Let me enumerate a few:

1) The sandwiches are just really damn good. My faves are the turkey and meatball. I go medium. The bread is always perfectly toasted. The special sauce on the turkey is downright dreamy. And on a cold day the meatball really hits the spot. 

2) I do not personally love avocado but having said that I could watch Q cut avocados all day long. If there was some kind of avocado slicing competition, Q would win. He is stunningly fast and unwaveringly accurate. And his style points would also be off the charts given that he insists on looking off into the distance while slicing the avocado, just daring the knife to slice his finger. It does not dare.

3) It took about a year of coming here consistently for Q to recognize and acknowledge me, often with a silent nod. About 2 years after that, I walked in and Q called out to me by name. I dropped to my knees and wept. I had worked hard and consumed many sandwiches just waiting for the day that Q would call me by name. When that day came, I was overcome. Now we chat a bit every time I go in. It goes like this:

Me: "Hey Q, how's it going?"
Q: "Hey Matt, you know, same old."

Indeed.

4) I love the fact that the cashiers are not allowed to interact with the sandwiches in any way. I have friends that complain about the wait times / lack of efficiency here. Sure, Marina Sub isn't winning any operational excellence awards but if you want a crappy, fast sandwich there are many places for that. Q is all about quality.

All in all, this place is the best. 

Also, I'm not currently on death row or even in prison.
author: matt c.

description:
I would give this place a higher rating because I think everything is expensive in this neighborhood and the Korean owner is like an artist with sub making. But recently i found out he was Korean. I just spent the year in Korea so I was so excited to tell him. When I asked him if he was from there he simply gave me a blank stare and said "yes" and then rolled his eyes. I thought he would be so excited. I guess my expectations may have been too high but really this guy is kind of a jerk. 

Anyways, the subs are pretty good and it's nice that you can order before hand. I don't find them particularly stingy like people complain about. On the contrary, I think they might put a little too much cheese on their subs and they are sooo generous with the avocado. 

A better attitude from the owner would have gotten them 4 stars.
author: Jaqueline M.

description: Had a meatball sub and italiano from this place.  I was impressed, pretty good sub!  I like the bread they use.  I'll probably be ordering from here again!
author: christopher h.

description:
Marina Subs is by far the best sandwich shop in existence. Seriously.

I have been going here for about 20 years after being introduced to it by my best friend in childhood. Q is exactly the same as he has always been - a machine. I don't think I have ever ordered avocado on my sandwich but watching him slice them is like art. I don't know anyone else that has a special avocado scooping spoon. He is always friendly no matter how busy the shop is.

My sister and I would frequent Marina Subs a lot during high school and he always recognized us. I haven't lived in SF for almost 8 years now, but come back to visit a few times a year. Marina Subs is always on my list of places that I have to eat when I am in town. The nice part is that when I go with my sister Q still recognizes us. (Doesn't work if I go by myself though, unfortunately.)

The shop hasn't changed much as you can tell when you go in. But it is CONSISTENT!

If you want to have the sandwich that makes Marina Sub the best I would recommend the Submarine with the special sauce. There is no better sandwich, just eat it quickly before it gets soggy! Oh and don't forget the Orangina.
author: Ben B.

description:
Good quality sandwich, and nice owner. Unfortunately the meat on the Italian classic is rather flavorless. The salami, cappicola and mortadella lack flavor. Otherwise the sandwich was quite good, with a perfect amount of nicely toasted bread, and good quality veggies and sauces. 

I'll probably try it now more time with a different kind of meat and hope that is better.
author: Jacqueline A.

description:
So I've heard abut this place but never been and on a nice sunny Sunday we wanted to grab a quick lunch before heading to the park.  We get there and it's a line out the door, my boyfriend told me this is not a gourmet sandwich but it's an experience.  So we get a large roast beef with avocado and no cheese.  

I can't say the ingredients were all that great, they really weren't and the fact that the sandwich was toasted saved the bread.  He did stuff it with tons of avocado so for the extra $1 I felt we totally got our moneys worth and for $10 total we had lunch, which is not easy to do in the Marina and get a decently healthy lunch.  Not sure I'm going to be rushing back anytime soon but it will be on my radar.
author: Inga W.

description:
Date & Time:  Tuesday March 24, 2009 @ 11am for Sandwiches To Go
Company:  Michael
Crowd:  Neighborhood Individuals(Mostly Guys) & Small Groups in College Sweatshirts,  Lululemon or Rock n' Republic Jeans
Vibe:  Chill
Decor:  Very Casual w/ Half Dozen Tightly-Packed Tables for Deux & Quatre 
Service:  Asian Sub Nazi
Devour:  Large(10 Inch) Hot Pastrami Sandwich w/ Provolone, Jalapenos & Special Sauce.  
Total:  $17.75 for Deux of The Above
author: Genevieve Y.

description: Great basic sandwich.  I was told to go prepared and with cash only.  The bread was toasted just a little too toasty for me but the flavor was great.  It's a messy sammich so definitely plan on it being drippy with lots of napkins.  But if you're looking for a basic toasted sub, this is the place.
author: Susan Z.

description: I have been a faithful customer for over 35 years, however the service has become so poor that I don't think I will come back.  I have been waiting for over 30 minutes since I placed my order and there is still no sign of my order.  Most of the subs are coming out burnt as well.  Extremely disappointing.
author: Heather M.

description:
Get any sandwhich.... add avo, and voila--- one of the better subs in sf....

eeasy beezy... done and done.
author: ilya g.

description:
I have been coming here for 20 years! My parents used to go on lunch dates at Marina submarine so our family has loved this place for two generations! When ever we are in the area we make a Submarine stop because they are delicious!!

The owner is NOT shy about filling his sandwiches with fresh ingredients! Our family favorite is the SUBMARINE sandwich toasted!!!! DELICIOUS!!!!!! And his secret sauce...So worth the wait!!!  

There is usually a wait because its just the owner slapping sandwiches together and the cashier ringing people up and answering the phone. IF YOU ARE IN THE MOOD FOR A FRESH DELICIOUS SANDWICH...Go to Marina Submarine. 

CASH ONLY!!!!
author: Gina S.

description:
Probably the best sandwich I had while living in San Francisco.  Yup, better than Ikes Place.  Although the line is SLOW here, it doesn't compare to Ike's wait time.

Marina Sub is a one man (the owner) operation.  The hired help is always a teenage kid, and I can't help but chuckle at the situation after the 15th minute of standing in line.  Here you have the owner chopping avocados into 40 slices, like Martin Yan from Martin Yan Can Cook (http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=qT9lKA5_bPI), and you have the hired help working the register never knowing what price to enter.

If the line is 5 deep, prepare to wait 20-25 minutes.

Outside of the long line, the sandwich is the bomb.  All the ingredients are fresh and you order by size.  I believe a large is 10 inches from what I can remember from the menu.  It's kind of weird, because the bread is maybe barely just longer than 10 inches, but he always cuts a slight edge off of the bread to make it 10 inches.  

What separates the sandwich is an addictive sauce he puts on the sandwich.  Make sure you do get the sandwich with the sauce.

Hours are kind of at the whim of the owner.  On Saturdays he usually closes up shop around 2:30/3pm.  Call that sucker in if you can or make it right before 12 on the weekends to avoid the lines.
author: Kyle W.

description:
I have been going here since I was a kid, and my Mom has been going here since she was my age. This place is the best in San Francisco, hands down. The first thing I thought of eating when I came back to visit family was getting a hot sub here. I brought my boyfriend here, and he absolutely loved it--comparing it with his local turkey hero in Richmond, Virginia. 

The guy who owns this place makes my day. Growing up, I used to love watching him cut avocado. Strangely, to this day he never looks like he's aged a bit. 

In terms of particularity, I've tried every sub here (seriously, I have), and everything is incredible. You won't be disappointed. Add avocado and cheese, and tell him to not cut your sandwich in half if you get a small.
author: Alex V.

description:
Being in Asia for half a year, I've truly truly missed sub sandwiches.  

I got a small hot pastrami sandwich, which was stuffed to the brim with pastrami and veggies.  I swear most places charge an arm and a leg for sandwiches, but this place is cheap cheap.  $5.69ish for a small, which is comparable in length to a 6 inch from Subway, but wayy wayy bigger.  I think you might have to pay a little extra for cheese, but it makes the sandwich.  

Not the best pastrami I've had.  I think the best hot pastrami sandwich is sitll from Subcenter, but I bump it up from 3.5 stars because of the nice proprietor.  He was kind enough to put mustard on only half of my friends' sandwiches because they were splitting two sandwiches and one of them didn't want mustard.  

Definitely going back here whenever I'm in that part of town!
author: Anna T.

description:
1. Definitely call in your order
2. The guy will tell you it will take 10 minutes
3. Don't go until 14 minutes - at that time the sandwich will have JUST been made so it's still warm and delicious but you won't have to wait and experience the death glare that those patrons in line will most definitely be giving you. NOTE: Be careful with the timing! If you wait too long the sandwich will no longer be toasty and hot and the whole calling ahead business will have been in vain b/c it will not be as delicious as it has been hyped up to be!

I've tried the pastrami, Italian and cheesesteak but my favorite, by far is the pastrami + provolone + avocado. Another tip: AVOCADO IS A MUST. Don't be cheap and skimp on this - it's like buying a brand new car and not splurging the extra bit for a navigation system (which is what I did and I still regret to this day).

Hopefully these tips will make your Marina Submarine experience a great one. One more thing, don't talk on the phone and carry 2 large sandwiches in the other b/c by the time you get to your destination you will have one nasty arm cramp.
author: Christina L.

description: Good subs and great atmosphere.  This place is a welcome throwback.  Great hot subs with very nice hot bread.  I strongly suggest giving this place a try when you have a few minutes at lunch and are in the mood for a nice sub.  The man at the counter who assume owns the establishment is pleasant and we really enjoyed our experience.
author: Brendan K.

description:
BEST sandwiches in the city for sure. I used to go to St. Vincent de Paul and it's literally right next to Marina Subs, and since I grew up with it, it holds a special place in my heart :] hahaha. But really, get the turkey sub with everything because it's amazing. The way the guy toasts the bread with the cheese... OMFG, it's perfection. I don't know how he does it but he toasts it JUST right. He's also INSANE with his avocados - if you're a fan, then definitely come here because he puts hella avocado in your sandwich. He's definitely THE master of avocado-slicing - he does it so quick and clean.  

I guess it's sort of pricey for a sandwich (around $7) but it's SOO frickin' good and filling, it's toootally worth it.
author: Christine A.

description: I love me a sandwich. Like I get made fun of by my family because I love a deli sandwich and will go out of my way to get one (Anderson Valley grocery, I see you). So when a shop says they're the best sub in San Francisco, I say, prove it. You walk in and I'll be honest, it's not much to look at. There's paper covering up menu items they no longer serve, like salads. However, there's a certain beauty to a limited selection of items. Plus, they more than make up for any lack of items with what can only be viewed as a show by a sandwich master. As I watched Q deftly disengage several avocados from their skins and then finely slice each half without a glance before sliding a full avocado onto another patron's large sub, I was transfixed by the man's skill and attention to each sandwich. I ordered a small but it was what I would describe as huge. All sandwiches are toasted which just adds to the overall flavor. Even though I let my sandwich sit (I had just had brunch, however I am sandwich crazy) and the special sauce (most likely an Italian dressing) had soaked the end of the bread, the thing was like biting into heaven. Seriously, this is one of the best things I've ever had in sandwich form. Anyone who rates this place under four stars is bunk and wouldn't know a great sandwich if a grilled cheese slapped them across the face. No frills (Thank God is arugula free) but awesome to the extreme. Yum!
author: aimee g.

description: This place is close to work and it's great when your starving! Plus the owner has great memories! I was amazed that he remembered my order and literally read my mind. The portions are huge but delicious! It does get very busy but it's totally worth the wait ;)
author: Pam Ela Y.

description:
i was a little worried about my encounter with the so called "sub nazi"...i didn't know what to expect as i entered marina submarine for the first time.  wifey said, "hm, i bet he's asian."  i said, "no way...i highly doubt that."  we both walk in and ta-daaaaa...it's a dude that could possibly be my uncle.  haha.  i know how to handle grumpy korean men...but this guy wasn't grumpy at all.  maybe cause we were probably his first customers of the day?  and there wasn't a line?  who knows...in any case, he was chill...no small talk...but in and out in no time.  

i listened to the other yelpers and ordered the large...wifey had no clue what she was getting into.  she saw him bust out with bread probably as long as the length from my wrist to my shoulder.  no joke.  and then wifey asked me, "are both of those just for us???"  hahaha.  but for around 8 bucks each...it was well worth it.  eat one half now...eat the other half for dinner.  it's called budgeting, folks!  

we ordered the italian beef with jalapenos and the italiano with avocado.  the italian beef was ok...but the winner winner was the italiano!  the sub nazi threw in an entire avocado...it was like buttaaaaaaaaaaa.  yum.  the combo of meats were super tasty...and the bread was nicely toasted.  the dood is not cheap with his toppings!!!  both sandwiches had to weigh over 5 lbs...it was like carrying my cat.  

cash only.  come when they open and beat the rush.  order the italiano.
author: Jen W.

description: What ever happened to sourdough hard-rolls? Not recommended unless you are hungry and want something right away.
author: Mag N.

description:
Super tastayyyy! Turkey + Avo + Special Sauce = Perfection. Order in if you're in a rush or else you might wait an extra few minutes than you thought (worth it though). Super generous with everything, including the avocado. In my opinion, you get more than you pay for. It's such a great little shop and the man makin' the sandwiches is one hard worker! 

- Keep in mind, it's cash only! There are ATMs nearby though.
author: Chelsea L.

description:
Discovered another great sandwich shop thanks to my friend :)

The sandwiches here are very fresh. It's their special italian dressing tasting sauce they use.
-They toast the bread perfectly. 
-Are not stingy with ingredients.
-When you order avocado they put A LOT and not just 2 or 3 slices (I REALLY appreciate this because I love avocado).

It's a bit more expensive than how much I usually pay for sandwiches, but these sandwiches are worth it. MMMmmmm, my mouth is watering as i type :9

Parking is hard in this area. Depends on what time you go though. Also, very limited seating. But I still totally recommend it. It's awesome :)

The old asian guy that works there is cool too.. I think he owns it. If you order avocado with your sandwich, make sure to watch his fast avocado slicing skills and how he lays that think layer of it over your sandwich. It's pretty exciting.... or I may be the only one that thinks this.
author: Sachiko K.

description:
Being sick of all the crappy sandwiches from nearby liquor stores..I decided to take a longer walk down to Marina Subs and try something new. I ordered a Turkey Sub with Sprouts...two minutes later I was out the door with a Sub and a bag of Funyuns. 
I ate my sub as soon as I got back to work..and I think I ate the entire thing in less than two minutes. It was truly the most killer sub that I've EVER had. The bread was toasted and slightly cripy. They didn't skimp on the meat and the condiments were just the right amount. 
I am just happy that I found a new place to go for lunch!
author: Mimi T.

description: Was visiting and came across this place. My friend and I split the large Atomic Sub and it was delicious and filled us both up. We made sure that we stopped in on our way out of SF to have another Atomic.
author: Jeff S.

description:
I thought I hated subs, but then I tried one from Marina Submarine and my life has never been the same!  My husband and his family have been regulars for years (brother-in-law even worked here as a kid).  It's a unique, local shop.  No atmosphere to speak of; just a sandwich shop.  We usually get ours and head outside for a picnic.  It's true that the lines are long, but that's because the owner insists on making the sandwiches himself.  The sandwiches are soooo worth the wait, though. 

If you are the type who is going to get royally bent out of shape by a long line, then complain because you weren't treated like a prince/princess, then you should definitely NOT visit this place.  You'll just make the line longer and more unpleasant for the rest of us.

If you're an average person who likes good food enough to wait for it, and you realize that the world does not revolve around you, then you MUST give this place a shot.  I don't think you'll be disappointed.
author: Areena M.

description: Fresh bread and great french dip sando!
author: Lyndsey M.

description:
Yup, this is one of my regular sandwich haunts. I've been hesitant to write something about it for fear that it'll be a zoo when gettin' my fix. Well, way too late. But by reading through most of the reviews and stumbling onto my ramblings, you might be pretty much "in the know". If not, be warned. This is a two person operation, sandwich maker/owner and some teenage kid working the register. Be prepared that when you go there for lunch...100's of other people have the same idea. I usually do late lunches (2p/3p) and have been lucky everytime with the wait time. I even have it for there with a table for myself. I KNOW!

Yes, the guy is skilled with the knife. I personally think he also moonlights as a sushi chef. I'm usually getting a medium Italian combo or Turkey w/swiss (toasted)...and I need to know that right then and there. He is known as the sub-nazi. Know what you want, know what it comes with, and know what you want or don't want on it...if not, he will be slightly irritated. I hadn't seen him do it yet - and I heard he has - but I'm waiting for him to bypass someone who didn't know what they wanted. Trust me, the place has it's regulars and he DOESN'T really need your business (or a lame 1-star rating on Yelp because you pulled an Elaine a la "Seinfeld"). And that's my kinda place!
author: Ted P.

description:
Been going here since I was in high school and love the place. Q (the owner) is a great guy, but his respect doesn't come easy... don't go in there expecting this guy to give you Grade-A customer service, but once you start going more regularly (as you certainly will) he starts to warm up once he remembers your face.

Best hot-sub's I have found in SF, blows their main competitor (Viking Sub) out of the water...
